revised_title: Fungal Biosynthesis: A Review of Mould Metabolic Products
tldr: This lecture discusses the biosynthesis of various compounds by fungi, particularly moulds, and their metabolic products. The author presents a detailed analysis of the chemical structures and relationships between different types of mould metabolic products, such as kojic acid, patulin, and derivatives of tetronic acid. The lecture also highlights the importance of understanding fungal biosynthesis for further research and applications in the field of biochemistry.
